Affordability in New Zealand

  • Auckland
  • /
  • Wellington
  • //
  • About

This application is created by Saeid Adli and Alex Raichev and inspired in part by the article "Housing and transport expenditure: Socio-spatial indicators of affordability in Auckland" by K. Mattingly and J. Morrissey [MaMo2014] (pay-walled).

This application is open-source. Its data and code can be found on Github here, and contributors are welcome. Thanks heaps to MRCagney for funding this project!

Regarding data sources:

  • The area units displayed are simplified versions of the 2013 census area units, the full versions of which come from Statistics New Zealand from here.
  • The median gross annual incomes of employed Aucklanders, Wellingtonians, etc. comes from Statistics New Zealand from the June 2013 income survey (grouped by regional council) here.
  • Rents come from the 2013 census via a custom data request from Statistics New Zealand. They are median rents per area unit per dwelling size.
  • The commute distances and times used are those of the quickest paths through the street network between area unit centroids. For walking, bicycling, and driving modes, these were calculated with ArcGIS using freeflow (no traffic) time. For public transport, they were calculated with the Google Maps API, which uses scheduled time, i think. We plan to improve driving time estimates by using the Google Maps API, which takes traffic into consideration. We also plan to improve the distance estimate for an area unit to itself, which is currently zero for all travel modes.
  • Commute costs per km come from [MaMo2014, Table 2] and are (walk, bicycle, car, public transport) = (0, 0, $0.274, $0.218). It would be better to use fare zone information for the public transport costs. Stay tuned.
  • Car ownership cost per car per year comes from [MaMo2014, Table 3] and is $2228.

Feedback? Email Alex. This application is a work in progress and your feedback will help make it better.
